This returns JSON object containing all the jobs submitted by the user along with the job status and result array for each of the job

API endpoint provides pagination limiting the number of items per request. Parameters for page number and the number of results per page can be used to fetch only the necessary results. The page number are numbered from 0
This endpoint return a filtered list of jobs

The current status of the submitted job (started, running, completed, failed) can be obtained by using the API endpoint. If the job is successfully completed, the result is an array of strings of the form /datarequest/result/{jobId}. This string when appended to the broker address forms the URL to download the data

This returns the parameters/metadata that are available for querying the dataset specified by {datasetid}. The response also includes the infromation if the user has accepted the Terms & Conditions of the dataset {datasetid}
This endpoint returns all the IDs of the different terms and conditions.
The request remove the acceptance of the Terms and Conditions
This endpoint returns boolean flag indicating if the user has accepted or not the Terms and Conditions of the {termId}.
The request sets the acceptance of the Terms and Conditions of the {termId} to True, meaning user has accepted the conditions.
